newsitem.title: UK: Britain frustrated by no HKG agreement with China.
newsitem.headline: Britain frustrated by no HKG agreement with China.

text.p: Britain said on Friday it had failed to reach agreement on crucial areas during talks with China to hammer out details of Hong Kong's handover on June 30.
Hugh Davies, a senior British representative taking part in the talks, said he was disappointed and frustrated that after five years of talks with China, all details had not yet been worked out.
Davies was speaking after the Anglo-Chinese Joint Liaison Group (JLG), the diplomatic body handling Hong Kong's return to China, had held three days of talks in London.

"Although we have reached some agreements this week, there are still a number of important matters where consensus is still elusive," Davies told a news conference organised by the British Foreign Office.
"Perhaps most disappointingly, we have failed to resolve our differences on right of abode."

"This is frustrating, because after almost five years of discussions, we are now in a large measure of agreement on almost all the substantive issues involved in this complex subject. But we need to close the remaining gaps."
